definitions.definition: (followed by on or upon) To concentrate one's attention.
definitions.example: I have to focus on my work.

definitions.definition: To cause (rays of light, etc) to converge at a single point.
To adjust (a lens, an optical instrument) in order to position an image with respect to the focal plane.
definitions.example: You'll need to focus the microscope carefully in order to capture the full detail of this surface.
If you're going to beat your competitors, you need to focus.

definitions.definition: To transfer the input focus to (a visual element), so that it receives subsequent input.
definitions.example: The text box won't receive the user's keystrokes unless you explicitly focus it.

definitions.definition: Directing all one's efforts towards achieving a particular goal.
Dealing with some narrowly defined aspects of a broader phenomenon.
